bibl.title: Tsunetaro Machida v. Luther Wedin. Petition for Order Allowing Appeal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
Petition for Order Allowing Appeal.
In the Matter of the Application of TSUNETARO MACHIDA? for a writ of habeas corpus.

THE PETITIONER, Tsunetaro Machida, by his Attorneys, Thomas R. Horner and Edward Judd, fooling himself aggreeved by this judgment, decision and decree sustaining the the finding of the Secretary of Labor, and remanding said petitioner to the custody of the Commissioner of Immigration, mad ontered and filed on the 26th day of September 1921, and having given notice of appeal from said judgment, decision and decree to the Clerk of this Court, and to the United States Attorney for this District, prays that his appeal to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals of the Ninth Circuit may be allowed, and that a transcript, of the record and all proceedings and papers upon which said judgment, decision and decree were made and entered, duly authenticated, may be sent to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

The Petitioner further states that he will within the time that is allowed by law, file herein his Assignment of Errors alleged to have been committed in the above entitled proceedings, and intended to be urged by the petitioner as appellant upon the procecution of this suit upon appeal.

The Petitioner further prays that this appeal may be allowed and the he be allowed to go on bail, by signing a recognizance in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000) for his appearance to answer the judgment of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit and to give himself into custody upon the order of said court.

The Petitioner further prays that Liberty Bonds in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1000), Eight Hundred Dollars ($800) of which are now in the custody of the Clerk of this court, and Two Hundred Dollars ($200) of which are to be forthwith deposited with said Clerk, be allowed to remain and stand as sufficient bond and security for the appearance of this appellant to answer the judgment of the United States
Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, and to give himself into custody upon the order of said last named court or upon the order of this Honorable Court.
Dated, Seattle, Washingotn, this 26th day of September 1921.
Thomas R. Horner and Edward Judd
Attorneys for Petitioner.
Received a copy of the foregoing petition this 26th day of September 1921.
Robert C Saunders
U.S. Atty for Respondent
Filed in the United States District Court
Western District of Washington
Northern Division
Tx
F.M. Harshberger, Clerk
S.E. Leitch Deputy
